comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: We're looking for your help! Please help us identify the location in this photograph in the comments below.

comment.author: 53503837@N05
comment._content: I feel confident in saying that this is the West Wing of the White House.  The original structure was built by Theodore Roosevelt in 1901, but additional stories were not added until the Hoover administration in the 1930s.  The cars are on what is now called W Executive Ave.  The photographer would be standing near the NE corner of the Eisenhower Executive Office Building, possibly even looking across the street from an upper-floor window.

comment.author: 62556299@N00
comment._content: I agree with CaseySeanM. Two modern views of the same entrance, but without the Monument: www.flickr.com/photos/rustypickens/2631952563/ www.flickr.com/photos/expo86/3782876489/

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Nicely done, CaseySeanM! Based on your comment, we did a bit more digging and all of us at the Smithsonian Institution Archives concur... it is the West Wing of the White House. Thank you!

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
The title has been updated!

Susannah
Smithsonian Institution Archives
